title: Authors and Citation
text: Yannick Marcon. Author, maintainer. OBiBa group. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marcon Y (2026). micar: 'Mica' Data Web Portal Client. R package version 1.2.0, https://www.obiba.org/micar/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {micar: 'Mica' Data Web Portal Client},   author = {Yannick Marcon},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 1.2.0},   url = {https://www.obiba.org/micar/}, }

title: Mica Data Web Portal Client
text: R package accessing Mica2 web services: * search type documents (variable, dataset, study, population, dce (datacollection event), network) * search taxonomy vocabularies terms * get data access requests form configuration listing reporting

title: Mica Data Web Portal Client
text: Steps: open connection Mica server extract process documents close connection Mica server Examples: search networks, studies, datasets variables get data access requests

Get the datasets — mica.datasets
text: Get datasets

title: Get the datasets — mica.datasets
code: mica.datasets(   mica,   query = "dataset()",   select = list("*"),   sort = list("id"),   from = 0,   limit = 10000,   locale = "en",   df = TRUE )

title: Get the datasets — mica.datasets
text: mica Mica object query search query select fields extracted sort fields sort item limit Max number items locale language labels (default "en") df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Open connection with Mica — mica.login
text: Open connection Mica returns Mica object. two-factor authentication mechanism enabled, user prompt one-time password input.

title: Open connection with Mica — mica.login
code: mica.login(   username = getOption("mica.username", "anonymous"),   password = getOption("mica.password", "password"),   url = getOption("mica.url"),   opts = getOption("mica.opts", list()) )

title: Open connection with Mica — mica.login
text: username User name mica. Can provided "mica.username" option. password User password mica. Can provided "mica.password" option. url Mica url list mica urls. Can provided "mica.url" option. Secure http (https) connection required. opts Curl options. Can provided "mica.opts" option.

title: Open connection with Mica — mica.login
text: Mica object.

title: Open connection with Mica — mica.login
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # login using credentials from mica.username and mica.password options m <- mica.login("https://mica-demo.obiba.org") # login by providing credentials m <- mica.login("administrator", "password", "https://mica-demo.obiba.org") } # }

title: Close connection with Mica — mica.logout
text: Close connection release resources Mica.

title: Close connection with Mica — mica.logout
text: mica Mica object

title: Get the networks — mica.networks
text: Get networks

title: Get the networks — mica.networks
code: mica.networks(   mica,   query = "network()",   select = list("*"),   sort = list("id"),   from = 0,   limit = 100,   locale = "en",   df = TRUE )

title: Get the networks — mica.networks
text: mica Mica object query search query select fields extracted sort fields sort item limit Max number items locale language labels (default "en") df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the studies — mica.studies
text: Get studies

title: Get the studies — mica.studies
code: mica.studies(   mica,   query = "study()",   select = list("acronym", "name", "objectives", "model",     "populations.dataCollectionEvents.model.dataSources"),   sort = list("id"),   from = 0,   limit = 100,   locale = "en",   df = TRUE )

title: Get the studies — mica.studies
text: mica Mica object query search query select fields extracted sort fields sort item limit Max number items locale language labels (default "en") df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the studies — mica.studies
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ m <- mica.login("https://mica-demo.obiba.org") mica.studies(m, query="variable(in(Mlstr_area.Lifestyle_behaviours,Drugs))",   locale="en", from=0, limit=10) mica.logout(m) } # }

what: Get the study data collection events — mica.study.dces
title: Get the study data collection events — mica.study.dces
text: Get study data collection events (DCEs). Note DCEs fetched directly, extracted study search results.

title: Get the study data collection events — mica.study.dces
code: mica.study.dces(   mica,   query = "study()",   select = list("populations.dataCollectionEvents"),   sort = list("id"),   from = 0,   limit = 100,   locale = "en",   df = TRUE )

title: Get the study data collection events — mica.study.dces
text: mica Mica object query search query select fields extracted sort fields sort item limit Max number items. Note limit applies studies fetched, resulting count DCEs higher. locale language labels (default "en") df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the study data collection events — mica.study.dces
Get the study populations — mica.study.populations
text: Get study populations. Note populations fetched directly, extracted study search results.

title: Get the study populations — mica.study.populations
code: mica.study.populations(   mica,   query = "study()",   select = list("populations.name", "populations.description", "populations.model"),   sort = list("id"),   from = 0,   limit = 100,   locale = "en",   df = TRUE )

title: Get the study populations — mica.study.populations
text: mica Mica object query search query select fields extracted sort fields sort item limit Max number items. Note limit applies studies fetched, resulting count populations higher. locale language labels (default "en") df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the taxonomies — mica.taxonomies
text: Get taxonomies, optionally filtered taxonomy name term matching.

title: Get the taxonomies — mica.taxonomies
code: mica.taxonomies(   mica,   query = NULL,   locale = "en",   target = "variable",   taxonomies = NULL,   df = TRUE )

title: Get the taxonomies — mica.taxonomies
text: mica Mica object query search query locale language labels (NULL labels included result) target taxonomy : variable (default), dataset, study, network taxonomies Taxonomy names subset. NULL empty taxonomies returned df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the taxonomies — mica.taxonomies
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ m <- mica.login("https://mica-demo.obiba.org") mica.taxonomies(m, target="variable", query="sex", locale="en",   taxonomies = list("Mlstr_area", "Mlstr_additional")) mica.logout(m) } # }

title: Get the variables — mica.variables
text: Get variables

title: Get the variables — mica.variables
code: mica.variables(   mica,   query = "variable()",   select = list("*"),   sort = list("id"),   from = 0,   limit = 10000,   locale = "en",   df = TRUE )

title: Get the variables — mica.variables
text: mica Mica object query search query select fields extracted sort fields sort item limit Max number items locale language labels (default "en") df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the vocabularies — mica.vocabularies
text: Get taxonomy vocabularies, optionally filtered taxonomy name term matching.

title: Get the vocabularies — mica.vocabularies
code: mica.vocabularies(   mica,   query = NULL,   locale = "en",   target = "variable",   taxonomies = NULL,   df = TRUE )

title: Get the vocabularies — mica.vocabularies
text: mica Mica object query search query locale language labels (NULL labels included result) target taxonomy : variable (default), dataset, study, network taxonomies Taxonomy names subset. NULL empty taxonomies returned df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the vocabularies — mica.vocabularies
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ m <- mica.login("https://mica-demo.obiba.org") mica.vocabularies(m,target="variable", query="cancer", locale = "en") mica.logout(m) } # }

title: New RQL node — rqlNode
text: Creates new RQL node represents operation.

title: New RQL node — rqlNode
text: name name operator ... arguments operation
